title: MCP Server Testing Patterns 2025
body:
# MCP Server Testing Patterns (2025 Edition)

Structured multi-phase testing methodology for MCP servers to ensure reliability, governance compliance, and safe knowledge operations.

## 1. Bootstrap & Schema Validation
- Validate instruction schemaVersion alignment
- Run list/get on base catalog (expect deterministic hash)
- Add temporary test instruction → get → delete → list (hash returns to baseline)

## 2. Mutation & Persistence
- Add N instructions (N<=3) sequentially, capture hash after each
- Restart server (process recycle) → verify hash unchanged
- Overwrite one instruction (rationale update) → verify updatedAt changes only

## 3. Concurrency Safety (Light)
- Rapid add/delete same ID (race probe) expecting: final state deterministic (present OR absent) without partial metadata

## 4. Integrity & Drift
- Run integrity/verify (if tool available) → zero mismatches
- Export backup → compute external hash of exported JSON for audit

## 5. Governance & Review Cadence
- Ensure owner, priorityTier, reviewIntervalDays set
- Verify nextReviewDue calculation matches interval

## 6. Analytics & Usage Tracking
- Track usage for a new instruction (usage/track) three times → hotset reflects presence

## Edge Cases
- Overwrite missing instruction (should create if supported OR error clearly)
- Large body (>10k chars) rejection handling
- Add with duplicate categories normalization

## Success Criteria
- All CRUD paths consistent
- Hash changes only when catalog materially changes
- No orphaned instructions reported

## Recommended Automation
- Nightly script executing phases 1–4
- Weekly governance scan (phase 5)
- Monthly analytics snapshot

## Removal Safety Pattern
1. List catalog
2. Export backup
3. Remove non-core IDs
4. Re-list & compare delta

Adopt this pattern to maintain a clean, reliable, auditable instruction index.
rationale: Provides a repeatable testing methodology to ensure MCP instruction reliability and governance health
